adjectives.description: pointed (comparative more pointed, superlative most pointed)

examples: The warrior brandished a pointed spear.

entries.meaning: (comparable) Having a relevance to the matter at hand: pertinent, relevant.
(not comparable) In animals, having a coat pattern with points, that is, darkening of the extremities.
examples: The Siamese is a pointed breed of cat.

entries.meaning: (comparable, of a comment or inference) Directed negatively at a person or topic.
examples: Attention has been called to the report in a New-York paper, which has been made the subject of pointed comment  […]

entries.meaning: (topology, algebraic topology, of a topological space) That has a named, but otherwise arbitrary, point (called the basepoint) that remains unchanged during subsequent discussion and is kept track of during all operations.
examples: The class of all pointed spaces forms a category - Top• - with basepoint preserving continuous maps as morphisms.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of point
